captions.text: At BMW there is a strong belief

that the best way
to predict the future is to create it.

Think of some of the most powerful letter
in the world.
BMW M set the standards for dynamic driving.
BMW i is not only beautiful,
it also stands for sustainability.

And now, with this car,
BMW creates the future of luxury.

Here it is,
the all-new BMW 7 Series.

I can't show you the design right now,
but I can show you some features.
Some of which you've never seen before.
Like this feature, for instance.
The new remote control parking function.

Pull in and out...
The car does it all for you.
No need to sit inside anymore.
To activate it, all you need is the key.
Well, forget everything you know about keys.

As a driver of the all-new BMW 7 Series,
you'll get a BMW display key.

Now this is a remote control
and LCD control screen in one.

It operates various functions
and supplies you with useful information.
This is just one example of many

for the new way of interaction
between driver and car.

And BMW will be first in class
to offer gesture command

as well as a navigation
with a touch screen for improved operating.
Also an all-new level of voice command.

BMW was the first car manufacturer
to use carbon fiber in production cars,

and is using
this intelligent lightweight material
in all-new BMW 7 Series vehicles.

We're at the BMW Plant Dingolfing
in Germany, near Munich.

Maybe you can tell us a bit more
about carbon fiber used in the BMW 7 Series.

{\an1}BMW is an innovation leader
when it comes to carbon in the auto industry.

We've now transferred the technology
from BMW i to the BMW core brand.

Carbon is a very innovative material.
It's light and it's rigid.

We strengthen the body,
for example the roof reinforcement.
And it's a part of our construction strategy.

Firstly,
it feels "BMW-like" when you drive it.
It doesn't feel like a big car.

On top of that, it lowers the weight
of the car and increases efficiency.
Carbon fiber is light, yet rigid.

It saves up to 50% of weight
over conventional materials,
while it also improves rigidity.

As we heard, the use of carbon fiber
goes hand in hand with driving dynamics.

And the BMW 7 Series has always been
the most dynamic car in its segment.

With the new generation model, the sense
of comfort and well-being excels equally.

The all-new BMW 7 Series combines comfort
and driving dynamics in a special way,

and is everything you expect,
setting exceptional standards.

You just hang in there,
the wait is almost over.

And be sure to tune back in again
for the next update
on the all-new BMW 7 Series.
